Class AskData

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • AskData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class AskData
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The askName class is the class that extends the JPanel and ask the user for their name. It implements action listener for the buttons.
    Version:
    3 05.29.15

    name: askName.java

    Instance Variables:

    name This is the string variable to store the user's name.

    difficultyNum This is an int variable that keeps track of the number of virtual days.

    critter This is a string variable that keeps track of the colour of the user's critter.

    userName This is the user name text field where the user enters their user name.

    critterChoice This is the text field where the user chooses which critter they want.

    Author:
    Jasmine Ou and Laura Wong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AskData

        public AskData()
        the fields method is used to ask for the user's name.

        Local variables:

        askTheName This is the label that asks the user for their name.

        okButton This is a the ok button that submits all the user's inputs and saves it.

        difficultyLabel This is the difficulty label that asks the user for it's difficulty.

        threeButton This is is the three button for 3 virtual days in the difficulty.

        insets This is the inset variable for positioning the buttons and label.

        size This is the dimension variable for positioning and getting the size of the buttons and the label.

        fiveButton This is is the five button for 5 virtual days in the difficulty.

        sevenButton This is is the seven button for 7 virtual days in the difficulty.

        group This is a group of buttons for the radio buttons.

        radioPanel This is a radio panel where the radio buttons are added on to.

        Local variables:

        character1 This creates the image of the first character.

        character2 This creates the image of the second character.

        character3 This creates the image of the third character.

        character4 This creates the image of the fourth character.

        character5 This creates the image of the fifth character.

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - this is the graphics variable that will be used to create the background colour for screen.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        This method is used when there is an action performed by the user through an input device. The first if statement is used to see if the user clicked the ok button or the three different day buttons. The nested if in the "ok" pushed if statement is used if the user inputted a username or not, if not then a message comes up indicating that they need to input a value. The try block is used to parse the integer value to see if the user inputted an inteer or not. The if statement in the try block is used to check if the user inputted a number within the desinated range (1, 2, 3, 4 or 5). The if statement in the else is used to store the colour of the critter that was chosen. The last if statement is used in the else to see if the user clicked the 7 days button.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - This creates an instance of the ActionEvent class and helps to see if an action has been performed.
